fields.description:
Here is an example of a stack that was updated with an AutoScaling Rolling Update (essentially requires an ASG that has either the LC or VPCZoneIdentifier changed.  The results from the stack below show that an update timed out even though enough success signals were received.


{code}
[root@g-08-01 ~]# euform-describe-stack-events stack3
EVENT	stack3	1bc0dc38-3c8a-4731-86eb-b95dc4af2c71	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	stack3	arn:aws:cloudformation::000976030144:stack/stack3/1b822e9f-ca16-493b-9ec8-21da6345ae32	2016-05-03T20:28:01.148Z	UPDATE_COMPLETE	
EVENT	stack3	LC-DELETE_COMPLETE-1462307279181	AWS::AutoScaling::LaunchConfiguration	LC	stack3-LC-DWF8775PDF2FS	2016-05-03T20:27:59.181Z	DELETE_COMPLETE	
EVENT	stack3	LC-DELETE_IN_PROGRESS-1462307278604	AWS::AutoScaling::LaunchConfiguration	LC	stack3-LC-DWF8775PDF2FS	2016-05-03T20:27:58.604Z	DELETE_IN_PROGRESS	
EVENT	stack3	6b609a59-2ef6-47e1-b2c7-c21a870186cd	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	stack3	arn:aws:cloudformation::000976030144:stack/stack3/1b822e9f-ca16-493b-9ec8-21da6345ae32	2016-05-03T20:27:37.791Z	UPDATE_COMPLETE_CLEANUP_IN_PROGRESS	
EVENT	stack3	ASG-UPDATE_COMPLETE-1462307256911	AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup	ASG	stack3-ASG-NJJ0TSPNTAQ45	2016-05-03T20:27:36.911Z	UPDATE_COMPLETE

EVENT	stack3	ASG-UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS-1462307256337	AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup	ASG	stack3-ASG-NJJ0TSPNTAQ45	2016-05-03T20:27:36.337Z	UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS	New instance(s) added to autoscaling group - Waiting on 1 resource signal(s) with a timeout of PT5M.
EVENT	stack3	ASG-UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS-1462307176212	AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup	ASG	stack3-ASG-NJJ0TSPNTAQ45	2016-05-03T20:26:16.212Z	UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS	Successfully terminated instance(s) [i-0e1cb271] (Progress 100%).

EVENT	stack3	ASG-UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS-1462306826180	AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup	ASG	stack3-ASG-NJJ0TSPNTAQ45	2016-05-03T20:20:26.180Z	UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS	Received SUCCESS signal with UniqueId i-29795e67
EVENT	stack3	ASG-UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS-1462306806391	AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup	ASG	stack3-ASG-NJJ0TSPNTAQ45	2016-05-03T20:20:06.391Z	UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS	Received SUCCESS signal with UniqueId i-003b9b36

EVENT	stack3	b5b0dbc8-92ca-434f-96b4-2fb6c7286aa0	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	stack3	arn:aws:cloudformation::000976030144:stack/stack3/1b822e9f-ca16-493b-9ec8-21da6345ae32	2016-05-03T19:33:47.526Z	CREATE_COMPLETE	
EVENT	stack3	ASG-CREATE_COMPLETE-1462304026664	AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup	ASG	stack3-ASG-NJJ0TSPNTAQ45	2016-05-03T19:33:46.664Z	CREATE_COMPLETE	
EVENT	stack3	ASG-CREATE_IN_PROGRESS-1462304026275	AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup	ASG	stack3-ASG-NJJ0TSPNTAQ45	2016-05-03T19:33:46.275Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	Received SUCCESS signal with UniqueId i-498eabf1

fields.summary: rolling updates sometimes does not succeed immediately if signals are received

comments.body:
A few things were done to address this.  For one, the main issue was due to maximum number of failed instances allowed.  This has been fixed.  In addition, signals were failing during UPDATE_ROLLBACK because it was found that UPDATE_FAILED resources to not get set to UPDATE_ROLLBACK_IN_PROGRESS.  This has also been fixed.  Finally, having different fields for different portions of the update process allowed the system to be put in an inconsistent state.  To that end, the following changes were made:

1) The db columns in the table rolling_update_state:  terminating_instance_ids, obsolete_instance_ids, and num_original_obsolete_instances were changed to a single field: obsolete_instances_json which contains all of the instances that are to be terminated in the rolling update, and their current state from the perspective of cloudformation.  (RUNNING, TERMINATING, TERMINATED).  This state may not reflect the actual instance state as it may have changed since it was queried.  The json string is of the form { instanceId: state, instanceId: state, ...}.
2) The db_columns in the table rolling_update_state: num_success_signals, num_failure_signals, num_needed_signals_this_batch, num_needed_signals_this_batch, num_received_signals_this_batch were all removed, and replaced with current_batch_instance_ids.  Signals are processed as create is, all signals are reloaded and processed, and the number of success/failure signals are recalculated each time.  (This allows a consistent picture).  In a given termination batch, the only signal ids that are dealt with are the signal ids of the instances that have been spun up since termination is complete.

The result of all of this is that the original conditions should not fail.  (i.e. failures should work as expected.)
Relates to EUCA-11679 due to the fact that during the verification, the {{UpdateStack}} call was cancelled.  {{UpdateStack}} was called again to complete the update to the stack.

*Eucalyptus Version*

{{4.3.0-0.25026.354.20160712git783d0ca.el7}}

*Steps*

# Create stack using linked {{cfn-as-create-update-policies-test-min.json}} template:
{code}
[root@c-34 ~]# euform-create-stack UpdatePolicyTest --template-file cfn-as-create-update-policies-test-min.json --parameter ImageId=emi-390608b5 --parameter EndPoint=http://cloudformation.c-13.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ --parameter MinSize=2 --parameter MaxSize=4 --capabilities CAPABILITY_IAM --region testrunner-admin@
arn:aws:cloudformation::000341583960:stack/UpdatePolicyTest/6b76cd83-fe8e-46b6-8eeb-8d7aaca64c6e
[root@c-34 ~]# euform-describe-stacks --region testrunner-admin@
STACK	UpdatePolicyTest	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	User Initiated	AutoScaling Create and Update Policy Test - MVP for CreationPolicy and UpdatePolicy with Resource Signals (Ubuntu 16.04 or Greater)	2016-07-18T20:18:57.655Z
PARAMETER	ImageId		emi-390608b5
PARAMETER	InstanceType		m1.medium
PARAMETER	EndPoint		http://cloudformation.c-13.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
PARAMETER	MinSize		2
PARAMETER	MaxSize		4
...
